DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of informed consent completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition._Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A systematic examination or assessment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, treatment that experts agree is appropriate, accepted, and widely used. Health care providers are obligated to provide patients with the standard of care.

Concepts.definition: An informed treatment recommendation that is expected to be helpful to the greatest number of people within a certain patient group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Objectively measurable phenotypic parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype, presence of biological substances) that characterize an organism's state of health or disease, likelihood of developing a disease, or response to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The charachteristic movements of drugs within biological systems, as affected by absorption, distribution, binding, elimination, biotransformation, and excretion; particularly the rates of such movements.

Concepts.definition: The characteristic movements of drugs within biological systems, as affected by absorption, distribution, binding, elimination, biotransformation, and excretion; particularly the rates of such movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.: Having been made available.

Concepts.definition: Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
To make available; set free.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. : Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Alteration in DNA that may indicate an increased risk of developing a specific disease or disorder.

Concepts.definition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Consent Module mc 12/28/09. Removed Number qualifier and modified Long Name, Definition and permissible values per group consensus 1/18/10 mc

ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2974066 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
